description: After applying the security update related to CVE-2024-43538, users may experience a total denial of service concerning the Windows mobile broadband driver. This situation renders systems unable to access critical network resources, as the broadband driver fails to function correctly, resulting in complete loss of availability. End users on affected systems with build numbers such as 10.0.26100.2033 for Windows 11 Version 24H2, or earlier builds from Windows 10 and 11, will find themselves unable to establish new connections or maintain existing ones. The KB articles associated with the update include KB-5044284, KB-5044285, and KB-5044273, which detail the problem, further emphasizing the importance of applying the fix. System administrators should monitor for this behavior to prevent disruptions in network connectivity and ensure users can effectively online resources reliably.
